intro: Cynanchica lilaciflora subsp. phrygia, commonly known as the Phrygian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and racemose inflorescence. The plant produces small, pale purple to lilac-colored flowers, which are typically clustered in dense spikes. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different floral morphology and geographic distribution compared to other members of the species.
